body.name: Ring Smart Lighting – Floodlight, Wired, Outdoor Motion-Sensor Security Light, White (Bridge required)
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Thursday, February 22. Order within 14 hrs 19 mins
features: A motion-activated floodlight that shines 2000 Lumens of brightness on driveways and other areas when motion is detected.
Add this to any Ring Smart Lighting Starter Kit with Ring Bridge so you can get notifications, customize settings, and connect to other Ring devices - all from the Ring app.

With the Echo (4th Gen), Echo Show 10 (3rd Gen), or Ring Bridge, you can connect this light with other Ring Smart Lights, Ring doorbells or cameras, and select Alexa-enabled devices to create a fully connected home security system.
Connects to standard electrical boxes with hardwired installation to provide a steady stream of power.

productInformation.name: Motion Detection
productInformation.value: Adjustable motion detection. Up to 180° field of view. Detection angle dependent on distance from unit. 70' detection range.

productInformation.name: Box Includes
productInformation.value: Ring Floodlight Wired, Installation Tools & Screws, User Manual, Security Sticker

productInformation.name: Setup Requirements
productInformation.value: Mount to 4” round weatherproof electrical box with included screws. Power drill and bits not included. Ring Bridge required for smart controls on the Ring app and to connect with other Ring products (sold separately).

productInformation.name: Warranty and service
productInformation.value: 1-year limited warranty . Use of Ring Smart Lighting is subject to the terms found here.

productInformation.name: Support
productInformation.value: Click here to view more information on the Ring Smart Lighting support page.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Ring Smart Lighting Floodlight: A Brilliant Addition to Home Security!
reviews.reviewText: The Ring Smart Lighting Floodlight has elevated my outdoor security game to a whole new level, providing both peace of mind and exceptional functionality. As a proud owner of Ring products, adding this wired outdoor motion-sensor security light to my setup has been a game-changer.Installation was surprisingly straightforward, especially considering the power-packed features it brings. The white finish is sleek and modern, blending seamlessly with my outdoor aesthetics. The motion sensor is impressively responsive, activating the floodlight exactly when needed without unnecessary triggers.The integration with the Ring Bridge enhances the overall experience. It allows for seamless connectivity with other Ring devices, creating a comprehensive security network around my home. The ability to control and customize the settings through the Ring app adds a layer of convenience that I truly appreciate.The brightness of the floodlight is remarkable. It illuminates my outdoor space effectively, providing a sense of security during the night. The fact that it's wired ensures a consistent power source, eliminating the need for frequent battery changes and ensuring uninterrupted operation.One of the standout features is the customization options available through the Ring app. From adjusting the motion sensitivity to setting specific schedules, the level of control provided is impressive. I can tailor the lighting to suit my preferences and security needs effortlessly.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Well made security system for my home. It lights up my driveway like a football stadium. Easy to install with a ladder & tools.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2024
reviews.reviewText: EASY TO INSTALL, VERY BRIGHT, WORKS GREAT, RECOMMEND

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 15, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Works well - installation not the easiest
reviews.reviewText: i had installed Ring floodlight cameras prior to installing the regular floodlights. Both the floodlight cams and regular floodlights work and integrate into the system well together. My only complaint so far (after 1 week of use) is that the installation of the regular floodlight is more tedious than the floodlight cam. My floodlight installation was complicated by a tall (second story) height. i was on an extension ladder with limited ability to reach everything easily. The main difficulty involved installing the very small fine thread machine screws that hold the unit to the base on the junction box. One has to hold the unit up in place with one hand while at the same time trying to start these small screws into a blind hole with the other. Kinda scary with no hands on the ladder up there. Very easy to do at ground level but hard on top of a second story ladder. This design should be changed somehow to make that easier for a homeowner to do and to provide more spares screws in case they tumble down to the ground (which they will). The fasteners on the floodlight cam were hex nuts that were much easier to work with.In summary i can recommend these lights for their intended purpose, but if you have an application that is on a second story or otherwise have difficulty reaching consider hiring an electrician to install them.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Edit: the company reached out to me after reading this review and sent me a brand new replacement. Thank you!I live in South Dakota and in one winter the sensor for the light stopped working. . I have 2 of these and one with the camera and one of the 2 stopped sensing motion along with the camera floodlight. All will turn on when synced with the other working floodlight.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Nice integration with existing Ring Lights
reviews.reviewText: I needed more lighting for taking my dog out at night. I had an existing Ring Flood Light Camera and I purchased 3 of the motion flood lights (along with the bridge) to integrate with the camera. I love that fact that I can put all of the lights in a device group and if any light detects motion all of them come on. When I first installed everything the new lights would only stay on for 30 seconds which was a little disappointing. I'm not sure if an update came out but I checked the settings the other day and I had the option to set them to 5 minutes. I wish they had the option the stay on until I turn them off manually (like I can with the Flood Light Camera) If I was working outside at night, but I am completely satisfied with the 5 minutes for now.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2024
reviews.reviewText: As described, easy to install, works great! Absolutely pleased with product and it’s functionality!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 17, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Innovation isn’t Ring’s thing…
reviews.reviewText: I just installed two of these lights to work with my existing Ring cameras. They work well, but lack features that should be standard in all ring products, that feature lights. First off, the length of time, before the light shuts off cannot be adjusted above 30 seconds, unless you add the light to a “group”. This is kind of a cumbersome way to design them. Second, all of my ring cameras have an option to adjust how bright they are, except these lights. You cannot dim them, which doesn’t really make any sense. I like how the lights can send motion alerts and trigger other devices with their motion sensors, like cameras or other lights, but the time between the motion sensor on the light triggering a camera to start recording is extremely slow. It takes almost 10 seconds between the motion and signal sent to the camera to actually start recording. This may not seem like much time, but I’m able to walk away from the light and around the corner, and the camera never sees me. I only get a recording of after I’m gone. Hopefully future improvements are made to these, to get them on par with their other devices, or even other brands out there, but after looking at the “new feature requests forum” from Ring, I’m not holding my breath. There are several great suggestions on there, that would be very easy for competent developers to implement, that are now going on 3 years old, and never added. All of this said, these lights work, and they work fairly well.
